page.title: 16Local Concern
page.content: Residents within the village are members of the{"Friends Of The {Quantocks". }This is a group dedicated to preserving the beauty of the hills for future generations. There is a{monitoring group } observing{quarrying at Triscombe}where they are extracting{Hangman's Grit } from the face of the hills. Its purpose is to see that the extraction does not exceed the tonnage granted in 1947. Heavy boulders are quarried for sea defences along our low-lying coastline, and a hard wearing small grit is in great demand for surfacing roads. It is anticipated that if the {Hinkley Point 'C' Nuclear Power {Station}is built, Hangman's Grit will be used in the foundations.
